lit. conceive, become pregnant Ge 16:4, Ge 16:4, Ge 16:5, Ge 16:19; Ge 16:36, Ge 25:21, Ge 38:18 (all J), 2Sa 11:5 (agency of man expressed by [[מִן]] Ge 19:36, [[לְ]] Ge 38:18); usu. in phr. [[וַתַּהַר וַתֵּלֶד]] Ge 4:1, Ge 4:17, Ge 21:2, Ge 29:32, Ge 29:33, Ge 29:34, Ge 29:35, Ge 30:5, Ge 30:7 (all J), v:Ge 30:17, v:Ge 30:19, v:Ge 30:23 (all E), Ge 38:3, Ge 38:4 (both J), Ex 2:2 (E), 1Sa 1:20, 1Sa 2:21, 2Ki 4:17, 1Ch 7:23, Is 8:3, Ho 1:3, Ho 1:6, Ho 1:8, prob. also 1Ch 4:17 [[ותהר]] [[אֶת־מִרְיׇם]] [[[ותלד]]] cf. Be; further Ju Jdg 13:3, and cf. Moses' question [[הֶאָנׁכִי הָרִיתִי אֵת כָּל־הָעָם הַזֶּה]] [[אִם־אָנׁכִי יְלדְתִּיהוּ]] Nu 11:12 have I conceived all this people, or have I brought it forth? Pt. f. ‖[[אֵם]] Ho 2:7, Ct So 3:4.

metaph. [[הָרִינוּ חַלְנוּ כְמוֹ יׇלַדְנוּ רוּחַ]] Is 26:18 of anxious and disappointed waiting; [[תַּהֲרוּ חֲשַׁשׁ תֵּלְדוּ קַשׁ]] Is 33:11, of futile planning, cf. Che; elsewhere of evil, mischief [[וְהָרָה עָמָל]] [[וְיׇלַד שָָׁקֶר]] Ps 7:15 (subj. wicked man), cf. Job 15:35, Is 59:4, so also v:Is 59:13, read [[הָרוֹ]] (Inf. abs.) cf. Di.
